meanings.definition: A written or printed work consisting of pages bound together.
meanings.sent1: I love reading books before bedtime.
meanings.sent2: She borrowed three books from the library.
meanings.sent3: The books on the shelf whispered stories to each other.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a library, with books of memories stacked neatly.
meanings.sent5: The smell of old books filled the room, transporting me to another time.

meanings.definition: A set of written, printed, or blank sheets bound together.
meanings.sent1: He carried his books in a backpack to school.
meanings.sent2: The bookstore had a wide selection of books on various topics.
meanings.sent3: The books on the desk were scattered like fallen leaves.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like pages in a book, waiting to be turned.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the books in her arms made her feel grounded and secure.

meanings.definition: A record of bets, as on a horse race.
meanings.sent1: The bookie kept track of all the bets in his books.
meanings.sent2: The books showed a history of wins and losses.
meanings.sent3: The books at the racetrack were full of excitement and anticipation.
meanings.sent4: His fate was written in the books of chance.
meanings.sent5: The books held the secrets of who would emerge victorious in the race.
